intro: Raddia verrucosa, commonly known as the rough raddia, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant features upright, hairy stems and narrow, lance-shaped leaves with a rough texture. Its flowers are yellow and are arranged in dense, spherical clusters. Raddia verrucosa is often found in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to arid environments.
